laboratory_examinations.findings: At 1 month and 15 days: interictal multifocal epileptiform discharges, noticeable bilaterally in the occipital region; at 8 months: extensive, multifocal epileptic discharges between seizures; at 1 year and 2 months: slow background activity, no occipital-dominated rhythm, interictal multifocal epileptiform discharges; at 1 year and 6 months: no occipital dominant rhythm, bilateral occipital spikes, slow waves, no seizures detected.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Progression from interictal discharges to extensive, multifocal epileptic discharges, then to slow background activity with no seizures detected at 1 year and 6 months.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Blurred T1 high signal in the hindlimb of the internal capsule, lack of white matter, high T2 signal.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: At 6 months: deep sulci, delayed myelination, little white matter, and thin corpus callosum; brain atrophy observed at 2 years and 10 months.

laboratory_examinations.findings: No pathogenic variants found that were extremely consistent with the phenotype.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Trio sequencing at 2 years and 5 months revealed a compound heterozygous variant of the ACTL6B gene.
